abstracts.cdata!:
The Amazon Basin Malaria Control Project
            aims to reduce malaria transmission in Amazonia and prevent
            its reintroduction to areas now under control. It will also
            seek to increase the Superintendency for Public Health
            Campaigns' (SUCAM) organizational efficiency and
            responsiveness to changing conditions. The project comprises
            two components: (i) a malaria control program supporting
            epidemiological and entomological surveillance, treatment of
            cases, source reproduction projects, vector control,
            education activities, and endemic disease control activities
            in Amerindian areas; and (ii) institutional strengthening of
            SUCAM focussing on in-service training, district offices,
            computerized information systems, operational research, and
            inter-institutional actions.
